info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 11 at 9:11AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 900 AM FRIDAY UNTIL 900 AM SATURDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Hinsdale, Mineral and Archuleta Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Lake City, Creede and Pagosa Springs. WHEN...900 AM Friday August 11 to 900 AM Saturday August 12 IMPACTS...The Bear Creek and Quartz Ridge wildfires will produce moderate to heavy smoke Thursday morning for parts of Archuleta and southern portions of Mineral and Hinsdale Counties. This smoke will decrease by late Friday morning as atmospheric mixing increases. By Friday afternoon, showers and thunderstorms with gusty, erratic winds could send smoke in any direction. By late Friday night, moderate to heavy smoke from the Bear Creek and Dry Lake fires will drain from Weminuche Creek in southern Hinsdale County southward into the Piedra area. Additionally, the Quartz Ridge wildfire in eastern Archuleta County could produce moderate to heavy smoke overnight for locations along East Fork Road westward to Highway 160 north of Pagosa Springs. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
